Text: Paul Pierce had 27 points, seven rebounds and seven assists, as the Boston Celtics held off a late rally from the Atlanta Hawks to escape with a 107-102 overtime win. The victory was the ninth consecutive win for Boston at the TD Garden, though it came with plenty of drama. The Celtics lost a 12-point lead in the fourth quarter, thanks to some stellar play from Josh Smith (32 points) and Jeff Teague (26 points). The Hawks missed a chance to win at the end of regulation, and the C's regained command in overtime behind an 8-1 run to close out the game, earning Boston their fourth straight win overall
